channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What on earth is going on with the American consumer?
item.description: U.S. workers are not sure whether to buy that new car — or brace for a recession.

item.title: This market pro says the Fed is going to cut interest rates this year, but ‘they don’t know it yet.’ Is he right?
item.description: Federated Hermes’s Steve Chiavarone crystalized the market’s view of where the Federal Reserve is heading on interest rates in one sentence.

item.title: ‘He failed in his fiduciary duty’: My brother liquidated our mother’s 401(k) for her nursing home. He claimed the rest.
item.description: “My brother, the executor of her will, coerced her during her illness to give him power of attorney.”

item.title: ‘I’m afraid to ask her’: My stepmother won’t show me my father’s will. What now?
item.description: “She treats my sibling and me as virtual strangers.”

item.title: Here’s why Goldman still sees 10% upside to the S&P 500, even with bond yields rising
item.description: Goldman Sachs took a look at rising bond yields and concluded that they’re still not a threat to the S&P 500 this year.
